page.title: 04Carnoustie Area Coastguard.
page.content: All coastguards have a very risky job,especially in the summer.Carnou- tie lies just past the estuary of the river Tay and at the east end of its long golden beach stands the coastguard's lookout tower.It is used as by the auxiliary guards.These men work only part-time and so to give full cover,24 hours a day,they work in shifts.summer.The area which the full- time coastguard covers stretches from Arbroath,north of Carnoustie,south past Crail and Anstruther.Without his auxiliaries,Mr Stewart,the full-timer, could not look after all his area. Carnoustie's beach is a particularly safe one and the coastguard rarely has problems with thoughtless tourists (or locals) using air-beds,as the current is not very strong.Most of his work comes in rescuing people who are stuck on the cliffs further up the coast.
